name: 1.1 - List types of images and non­imaging data provided
1.2 - Report on the completeness of the data
1.4 - Specific instructions on how to gain access to the data.
1.6 - Confirm that the ethics board of the host institution generating the data approves the sharing of the data made available
1.7 - Clarify any constraints on uses of shared data.
1.8 - Provide URL to documentation, and specify its scope
1.9 - Report the format of the image data shared.
1.10 - Data organization structures, including Data Dictionaries and Schemas.
1.11 - Is the software using an established ontology?
1.12 - Availability of in-resource visualization of the imaging or non­imaging data
1.13 - How, if at all, data are de-identified ?
1.14 - Availability of detailed provenance of preprocessing and analysis of shared data
1.15 - Ability of a repository to work in a multi-database environment, availability of API’s and ability to connect to analysis pipelines
1.16 - Mechanisms available for constructing queries on the repository (e.g. SQL, SPARQL)
1.17 - How users can check version of downloaded data and compare it to the current version at a later time
